Text.Value: Moonmaiden? Who the hells are you two?
That was me. I did that. How...?
No, I'm not giving up on you. We can weather whatever Shar has in store for us, together.

EditorData.NodeContext: Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: I don't believe it. Tell me it's not real, my Lady. Tell me it's a test.

EditorData.stateContext: Huge visage of Shar present, looming over SH, her parents and the player. Dark, swirling Shadowfell atmosphere. Shar has sword arm (right arm) lowered out of sight, and left hand appearing to be holding the platform on which SH and co are standing. Shar gazes down at them

Text.Value: Unleash Lady Shar's power. Sacrifice them.
Ask your sire - he knows. You are all bound to each other. And to me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: You'll never be entirely free of her torments as long as we draw breath. You must end this - give us Selûne's mercy.
Now this place is yours to command, and my power is yours to wield, my Chosen.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud, triumphant. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: I'm here to get you out of this place.

EditorData.NodeContext: Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: They are nothing. Empty husks. Remnants of your sacrifice in my name.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud, triumphant. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Argh! Moonmaiden preserve us...

EditorData.AnimationTags: [PN] Both Parent's Wrythe in pain as SH approaches
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: - both the prisoners suddenly writhe in pain against their restraints. Shadowheart glances down at her right hand in surprise.

Text.Value: *Your chance at freedom from Shar's curse, and your parents' very lives - they are entwined. One cannot be claimed without the loss of another.*
But I only just found you again.
They remember everything. The pain. The pleading. Their torturer, wearing their daughter's face. End their nightmare. Give them peace.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Now you're here, and we can rest.
You can. You must.

EditorData.NodeContext: Firm. The soothing tones from before are quickly fading. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Yes. Jenevelle. Our little Jen...
Ignore Shar. Turn to free your parents.
Their wrongheaded resolve allowed me to shape you - their daughter. Time to remember.
No longer. Forget. Forget and rise.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: It is not over.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Shadowheart doubles over in pain as her incurable wound flares intensely. Her parents also writhe in agony. Finally it abates and Shadowheart stands
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart doubles over in pain as her incurable wound flares intensely. Her parents also writhe in agony. Finally it abates and Shadowheart stands. Shar lowers the sword arm (right arm) out of view and gazes intently down at SH and co. Left arm still appears to be holding them up.
EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

Text.Value: There is nothing to forgive. You did what was necessary. To survive.
We will see you soon, with the Moonmaiden's guidance.
We made it, Emm. She came back for us. It's over.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Shadowheart's hand begins to glow with Selûnite power. It intensifies, engulfing her and her parents. The player turns away...
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Shadowheart's hand begins to glow with Selûnite power. It intensifies, engulfing her and her parents. The player turns away...

... the glow fades. Shadowheart's parents are gone. In their place are two floating motes of light. They dance gently in the air before Shadowheart. She smiles at them.

Text.Value: We never stopped. Thank you, Moonmaiden. You let me see my Jenevelle, my baby girl, one last time.
Kill them, for me. Then I will take the memories away from you again. Loss will heal you, and you will be my right hand, at last.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reasoning, urging. Soothing, but with a hard edge to it. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: I'm here to get you out of this place.
Not harming us - freeing us. The dream that you'd find your way back to us was the only thing that kept us going, all these years.
Won? Your victory is but a guttering candle in the dark. Temporary. Inconsequential.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Whatever happens, we love you all the same.

EditorData.stateContext: Huge visage of Shar present, looming over SH, her parents and the player. Dark, swirling Shadowfell atmosphere. Shar is in the same pose that the huge Shar statue at the centre of her temple in act 2 took (left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left)

Text.Value: Jenevelle? Jen? Is that you? Why, you look so tall...

EditorData.stateContext: Shadowheart is on her knees before her dead parents. Shar visage still present

Text.Value: And you did. You found us.
The hells with this. I'm here to save you.
*Shar's parting words make your flesh crawl. You fear that you know all-too-well what choice she spoke of, though you wish it wasn't so.*
Just let us know where to go - we'll find our way.

EditorData.AnimationTags: A dark aura pulses from the black mirror, casting shadows throughout the chamber. Shadowheart doubles over in pain as her incurable wound flares intensely. Her parents also writhe in agony. Finally it abates and Shadowheart straightens - to see a vast silhouette of Shar leaning over her and her parents. Shar's features cannot be clearly seen, but her words reverberate through SH's head.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The chamber seems to grow darker suddenly. Shadowheart sees a vast silhouette of Shar leaning over her and her parents, in the same pose that the huge Shar statue at the centre of her temple in act 2 took (left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left) Shar's features cannot be clearly seen, but her words reverberate through SH's head.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Shadowheart's hand begins to glow with Selûnite power. It intensifies, engulfing her and her parents. The player turns away... the glow fades. SH's parents are now free of their restraints, weak on their feet. Shadowheart embraces them gently.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's hand begins to glow with Selûnite power. It intensifies, engulfing her and her parents. The player turns away... the glow fades. SH's parents are now free of their restraints, weak on their feet. Shadowheart embraces them gently.

Text.Value: You showed great promise, but no more. When the darkness finally comes for you again, it will not be my welcoming embrace - it will be a hungry maw, then nothing. Farewell.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bitter, angry. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Goodbye.
It's true. We are still bound to you. You cannot both free us and free yourself from her curse.
It's me. I'm Jenevelle.

EditorData.NodeContext: Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: You're a monster, not a goddess.
Is it over? Have I proven myself, Lady Shar?
I... I hurt you both. So much. Gods forgive me...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shar's visage fades away. The dark aura in the chamber of loss recedes.

Text.Value: Go then, leave - the dark will still be waiting. But keep some memories as a parting gift.

EditorData.NodeContext: Anger rising as she's being opening defied. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: No, Jenevelle, you mustn't. We'll be a burden to you -
First I need to get you out of these restraints. Then find your way to our camp - you'll be safe there.
It is done. And done well. They are with me now, in my endless dark. And from them, you can draw endless power.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud, soothing. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: No. I can't do this.
It is a test, but they are also who they appear to be - your parents. Your flesh and blood. Your sacrifice to make.

EditorData.NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: You see? It matters not if you raze this place, if you slay every one of your brothers and sisters. That was never where my power resided.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: They're... they're my parents? What have you done to them?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart winces as a flood of memories are restored to her.
EditorData.NodeContext: Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: It is what we need, all of us. You were meant to be a guiding light for Selûne's faithful, but they robbed you from us. Now that can be righted, and we can rest.

EditorData.stateContext: Shadowheart and parents in Chamber of loss. Parents are bound to Sharran discs/wheels by their limbs.

Text.Value: It can't be. Another vile trick -

EditorData.AnimationTags: [PN] LOOPs of Emmeline and Arnell in restraints in same pose as recorded VO. Wound flares and Arnell in pain
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart approaches two upright discs upon which an elf man and human woman are restrained to each. (This should be reminiscent of the figure SH glimpsed in Shar's symbol during her vision after killing Nightsong). The elf man lifts his head to see Shadowheart and reacts with disbelief. His disc flares. He breaks off with a cry of pain.

Text.Value: We, Shadowheart. We did this to them together. My power, and your will.

EditorData.NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: *Moon motes. They bring Selûne's light to dark places and offer guidance to those in need. Your parents still watch over you.*
Once, they were among the most fanatical of my sister Selûne's followers, but for years they have been here, resisting my embrace.

EditorData.NodeContext: All-powerful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Eloquently put. His mind stood up well to his time here. The same cannot be said for your mother - such brief, fragile lives humans lead.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: That was me... I hurt them. How?

EditorData.NodeContext: Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: Do you remember your training, child? I know you do. All the times you stood in this room, wondering why this pair seemed so familiar. All the times you honed your skills on them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: It's not her, Emm. It's just another trick. Another way to hurt us.
Are you sure this is what you want?
I knew the dark woods wouldn't frighten you. You were always such a brave girl.
It's me. I'm Jenevelle.
I still remember. Everything I did to them.
This can't be... Are they my parents? What have you done to them?
Jenevelle is no more. She never left those dark woods - it was Shadowheart who emerged. This woman gave birth to you, but I made you. I am your Mother.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reasoning, urging. Soothing, but with a hard edge to it. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: First you must forget. The sacrifice has been made. Surrender all memories of these two to my embrace.

EditorData.NodeContext: Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: I am neither. I am nothing. I am the empty room. The dreamless sleep. The shadow's shadow. There was no pain before my sister set the sun aflame. Now you exist to suffer, until you find your way back to my embrace.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: You cannot. We are still bound to you. You cannot both free us and free yourself from her curse.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar)

Text.Value: *And they wish for you to leave this place behind.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The moon motes flit away out of frame, as if heading for the exit.

Text.Value: The Moonmaiden needs you more than she needs us. You are the future - you must return to the fold. We are the past. And our duty is almost done.
Soon a great battle will commence in this city - and you shall lead my forces to victory. Now go forth.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud, triumphant. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Shadowheart blinks in confusion, glancing around. She rises back to her feet.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart blinks in confusion, glancing around. She rises back to her feet.

Text.Value: As for their names, this is Arnell Hallowleaf, and his wife, Emmeline.

EditorData.NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: You're a monster, not a goddess.

EditorData.NodeContext: Angry, defiant. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: Do as you are commanded to. End their suffering.
No. I'm leaving this place. I'm leaving you. And I'm taking my parents with me.
I still remember. Who they were. What I did to them...

EditorData.NodeContext: dazed, shocked. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess’s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: And I have my daughter back. What more could a mother want?
Did she mean what I think she did...?
Their wrongheaded resolve allowed me to shape you. But I need not tell you - I can show you. It is time to remember. Time to remember everything.

Every time you try to step away from me, every time you try to reach for Selûne, my hold on you bites deeper. If you had learned, if you had obeyed, there would be no pain. But you struggle on. You make things worse for yourself. And for them.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: All these years, that dream kept us going, that you would break free. No matter what they made you do to us, we knew you were still in there.
Their names are Arnell Hallowleaf, and his wife, Emmeline.

EditorData.NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: What am I to do now?
You are just lost, Jenevelle. Selûne will show you the way home, in time -
I'm not harming you. I can't.
You did all that I asked of you. You made one last sacrifice in my name, now this place is yours to command, and my power is yours to wield, my Chosen.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud, triumphant. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Shar's visage fades away. The dark aura in the chamber of loss recedes. Shadowheart's parents are both freed from their soul cage bonds.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shar's visage fades away. The dark aura in the chamber of loss recedes. Shadowheart's parents are both freed from their soul cage bonds.

Text.Value: Who are these people?
Their wrongheaded resolve allowed me to shape you. But I need not tell you - I can show you. It is time to remember. Time to remember everything.
I don't care - I've found my parents. I've won.
This was my gift to you. Power is not created; it merely changes from one form to another. Their pain becomes your might. Their suffering furthers your glory.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shar lowers the sword arm (right arm) out of view and gazes intently down at SH and co. Left arm still appears to be holding them up.
EditorData.NodeContext: Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

Text.Value: I'm getting you out of here. There's a place where you'll be safe.
Shar is a spiteful creature. She will never admit defeat - not until she has stolen one last thing from you. Your future must not be her final prize. Not after all we have endured to see you again.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shar's silhouette melts away and the dark Shadowfell aura fades. The room is as it was before.

Text.Value: Not so little now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud

Text.Value: This is my final lesson. I leave you now, to dwell on your mistakes and make your choice. End their suffering and free yourself. Or prolong the pain, together.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

EditorData.stateContext: Huge visage of Shar present, looming over SH, her parents and the player. Dark, swirling Shadowfell atmosphere. Shar has sword arm (right arm) lowered out of sight, and left hand appearing to be holding the platform on which SH and co are standing. Shar is gazing down at them.

Text.Value: We will find the way from here. Do what you need to, Jenevelle.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [PN] SH's power flares wildly, engulfing the pair. Their Sharran disc restraints vanish and they collapse to the floor, dead. Shadowheart drops to her knees, in shock.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SH's power flares wildly, engulfing the pair. Their Sharran disc restraints vanish and they collapse to the floor, dead. Shadowheart drops to her knees, in shock.

Text.Value: The Moonmaiden will guide us. Just as she guided you.
Help us, Jen. I can let go, now I've seen your face again.
I shall carry out your will, my Lady.
Indeed, Shadowheart.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud, triumphant. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Not goodbye. Not even close.
Use Selûne's power to break their bindings.

EditorData.stateContext: Shadowheart standing before dead parents. Shar visage still present - right arm at her side, left arm holding SH's platform up by her palm

Text.Value: What happened? I remember entering this chamber, then... nothing.
She was. And still is. You've saved us. Now save yourself. You'll be out of Shar's reach, and we'll be at peace.
First I need to get you out of these restraints. Then find your way to our camp - you'll be safe there.

EditorData.NodeContext: Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: The hells with this. I'm here to save you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: So much was done to mould you, and still you turn your back on me, for two strangers that you share blood with?

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Just as I wished them to.

EditorData.NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Hush, Arnell. The Moonmaiden guides her, don't you see?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressing her husband, but looking at SH with a studying, reverential expression

EditorData.AnimationTags: The chamber seems to grow darker suddenly. Shadowheart sees a vast silhouette of Shar leaning over her and her parents. Shar's features cannot be clearly seen, but her words reverberate through SH's head.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The chamber seems to grow darker suddenly. Shadowheart sees a vast silhouette of Shar leaning over her and her parents, in the same pose that the huge Shar statue at the centre of her temple in act 2 took (left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left) Shar's features cannot be clearly seen, but her words reverberate through SH's head.

Text.Value: I am neither. I am nothing. I am the empty room. The dreamless sleep. The shadow's shadow. There was no pain before my sister set the sun aflame. Now you exist to suffer, until you find your way back to my embrace.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Jen wants her family. Jen shall have her family. How can we help, dear?
Call on Selûne's power to end their suffering.
Jenevelle... Is that my name?
You did it, Jen. You found your way home.
If this is a test, what must I do?
A sacrifice is not a sacrifice if it has no meaning. This is the final step - snuff out the last embers of your old life, so that you can finally be who you were meant to be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reasoning, urging. Soothing, but with a hard edge to it. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: No... there is no trick. It's her. Jenevelle. Jen. Our little girl.
I thought you were my goddess... but you're just a monster.
They are part of my gift to you. Power is not created; it merely changes from one form to another. Their pain becomes your might. Their suffering furthers your glory.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shar lowers the sword arm (right arm) out of view and gazes intently down at SH and co. Left arm still appears to be holding them up.
EditorData.NodeContext: Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

Text.Value: Don't call me that. My name is Shadowheart.
We'll still be with you. By the Moonmaiden's grace, we'll never be far. Please, Jenevelle.
Moonmaiden's grace. It is you...
No, I'm not giving up on you. We can weather whatever Shar has in store for us, together.
It can't be. Another vile trick...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart approaches two upright discs upon which an elf man and human woman are restrained to each. (This should be reminiscent of the figure SH glimpsed in Shar's symbol during her vision after killing Nightsong). The elf man lifts his head to see Shadowheart and reacts with disbelief. His disc flares. He breaks off with a cry of pain.

EditorData.stateContext: Huge visage of Shar present, looming over SH, her parents and the player. Dark, swirling Shadowfell atmosphere. Shar is in the same pose that the huge Shar statue at the centre of her temple in act 2 took (left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left)

Text.Value: You learned so much, applying your skills to these two. Now you can remember it all, whenever you look upon their faces.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bitter, angry. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Synopsis:
Avatar Shadowheart meets with her parents once again, who have been imprisoned for decades. A vision of Shar appears and demands Shadowheart sacrifice her parents.
Note: there are two major tracks in this scene - if SH comes to it as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess's command, or as someone who has turned from Shar and is coming to rescue her parents.
